tit.cmt: タイトルのため、単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 久我（こが）家は、日本の氏族。
sen.e: The Koga family is a Japanese clan.
The Koga family is a Japanese clan.
The Koga family is a Japanese clan.

sen.j: 村上源氏の総本家にあたる。
sen.e: The Koga family was the origin of the Murakami Genji.
The Koga family was the origin of the Murakami Genji.
The Koga family was the origin of the Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 貴族・公家・華族の家柄。
sen.e: The Koga family achieved the rank of nobility, court nobility and hereditary peerage.
The Koga family achieved the rank of nobility, court nobility and hereditary peerage.
The Koga family achieved the rank of nobility, court nobility and hereditary peerage.

sen.j: 公家としては清華家、華族としては侯爵家の家格を有した。
sen.e: The Koga family had the grade of Seiga as court nobility and the grade of baron as Kazoku.
The Koga family had the grade of Seiga as court nobility and the grade of baron as Kazoku.
The Koga family had the grade of Seiga as court nobility and the grade of baron as Kazoku.

sen.j: 源氏堂上源氏のひとつ。
sen.e: The Koga family was one of the Dojo Genji.
The Koga family was one of the Dojo Genji.
The Koga family was one of the Dojo Genji (the Minamoto clan allowed to enter the Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、Dojo Genjiの補足追加 (参考: http://www.marutoku.jp/roots/Kminamoto2.html)

sen.j: 久我家が明治維新までに輩出した公卿の数は35名。
sen.e: The Koga family produced 35 Kugyo before the Meiji Restoration.
The Koga family produced 35 Kugyo before the Meiji Restoration.
The Koga family produced 35 Kugyo before the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: うち太政大臣まで昇った者7名、左大臣まで昇った者0名、右大臣まで昇った者4名、内大臣まで昇った者6名である。
sen.e: Among them, 7 were promoted up to Daijo-daijin, 0 up to Sadaijin, 4 up to Udaijin and 6 up to Naidaijin.
Among them, 7 were promoted up to Daijo-daijin, 0 up to Sadaijin, 4 up to Udaijin and 6 up to Naidaijin.

Among them, 7 were promoted up to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister of State), 0 up to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), 4 up to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and 6 up to Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior).
sen.cmt: Daijo-daijin, Sadaijin, Udaijin, Naidaijinの補足追加

sen.j: 村上天皇の皇子具平親王の子源師房が寛仁4年（1020年）に源朝臣の姓を賜わり、その孫にあたる源雅実が祖。
sen.e: In 1020, MINAMOTO no Morofusa, a child of the Prince Tomohira of the Emperor Murakami, was given the surname of MINAMOTO no Ason and MINAMOTO no Masazane, the grandchild of this prince, founded the family.

In 1020, MINAMOTO no Morofusa, a child of the Prince Tomohira of the Emperor Murakami, was given the surname of MINAMOTO no Ason and MINAMOTO no Masazane, the grandchild of this prince, founded the family.

In 1020, MINAMOTO no Morofusa, a child of the Imperial Prince Tomohira of the Emperor Murakami, was given the surname of MINAMOTO no Ason and MINAMOTO no Masazane, the grandchild of this prince, founded the family.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、Prince Tomohira→Imperial Prince Tomohiraとしました。

sen.j: 久我という家名は、源師房の代より伝えられ、山城国愛宕郡久我（こが）（現在の京都市伏見区久我）に構えた久我水閣が由来。
sen.e: The family name Koga was succeeded from the period of MINAMOTO no Morofusa and has its origin in a villa named Kogasuikaku, located in Koga, Otaginokori District, Yamashiro province (today Kuga, Fushimi District, Kyoto-city).

The family name Koga was succeeded from the period of MINAMOTO no Morofusa and has its origin in a villa named Kogasuikaku, located in Koga, Otaginokori District, Yamashiro province (today Kuga, Fushimi District, Kyoto-city).

The family name Koga was succeeded from the period of MINAMOTO no Morofusa and has its origin in a villa named Kogasuikaku, located in Koga, Otagi District, Yamashiro Province (today Koga, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: Otaginokori District→Otagi District、Kuga→Koga、Fushimi District→Fushimi Wardに修正、およびYamashiro Province、Kyoto Cityとしました。(参照: http://www.yu-bin.net/pc/html/26109.html#ka)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代前期の源通親は内大臣となり、権勢を振るい「源博陸（はくろく・はくりく＝関白の異名）」と称された。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Michichika, who was in power in an early part of the Kamakura period, became the Naidaijin and was called 'MINAMOTO no Hakuriku (Hakuroku)' (synonym of Kanpaku), because he wielded considerable influence.

MINAMOTO no Michichika, who was in power during an early part of the Kamakura period, became the Naidaijin and was called 'MINAMOTO no Hakuriku (Hakuroku)' (synonym of Kanpaku), because he wielded considerable influence.

MINAMOTO no Michichika, who was in power during an early part of the Kamakura period, became the Naidaijin and was called 'MINAMOTO no Hakuriku (Hakuroku)' (synonym of Kanpaku), because he wielded considerable influence.

sen.j: 久我家は、室町時代、足利義満の代までは源氏長者・淳和院奨学院両院別当を出した。
sen.e: The Koga family produced Genjichoja and Betto (Directors) of the Junnain and the Shogakuin until the generation of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGAWA in the Muromachi period.
The Koga family produced Genjichoja and Betto (Directors) of the Junnain and the Shogakuin until the generation of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGAWA in the Muromachi period.
The Koga family produced Genji Choja (head of the Minamoto clan) and Betto (Directors) of the Junnain and the Shogakuin until the generation of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Genjichoja→Genji Chojaとし、補足説明追加、Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGAWA→Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGAに修正

sen.j: また戦国時代には再び久我家から源氏長者が出されるようになったが、久我通堅を最後に源氏長者は徳川家に奪われることとなった。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period, the Koga family produced again Genjichoja, but Michikata KOGA was the last person who became Genjichoja as Koga family, because it was then taken by the Tokugawa family.
In the Sengoku period, the Koga family again produced Genjichoja, but Michikata KOGA was the last person who became Genjichoja as Koga family, because it was then taken by the Tokugawa family.

In the Sengoku period (period of Warring States), the Koga family again produced Genji Choja, but Michikata KOGA was the last person who became Genji Choja as Koga family, because it was then taken by the Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 「戦国時代」→表記を統一余分なスペース消去、Genji Chojaとしました。

sen.j: 幕末維新の混乱期に一時久我建通が源氏長者となったともいわれるが、真偽は不明。
sen.e: It is said that Tatemichi KOGA became Genjichoja during the chaotic days of the end of Edo period and the Meiji restoration, but nobody knows whether it is rue or not.
It is said that Tatemichi KOGA became Genjichoja during the chaotic days of the end of the Edo period and the Meiji restoration, but nobody knows whether it is true or not.
It is said that Tatemichi KOGA became Genji Choja during the chaotic days of the end of the Edo period and the Meiji Restoration, but nobody knows whether it is true or not.
sen.cmt: Genji Chojaとし、前出の表記に合わせ、the Meiji restoration→the Meiji Restorationに修正

sen.j: 一般には通親の子・久我通光からを久我家と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Generally, the Koga family refers to the descendants on and after Michiteru KOGA, a child of Michichika.
Generally, the Koga family refers to the descendants on and after Michiteru KOGA, a child of Michichika.
Generally, the Koga family refers to the descendants on and after Michiteru KOGA, a child of Michichika.

sen.j: 当道座の本所であった。
sen.e: The Koga family was the headquarters of the Todoza, a guild of blind men.
The Koga family was the headquarters of the Todoza, a guild of blind men.
The Koga family was the headquarters of the Todoza, a guild of blind men.

sen.j: 江戸時代には家禄700石、摂関家に次ぐ清華家の家格を有した。
sen.e: In the Edo period, the family had a revenu of 700 koku and the family rank of Seiga, next to the Sekkan, the regent house.
During the Edo period, the family had a revenue of 700 koku and the family rank of Seiga, next to the Sekkan, the regent house.
During the Edo period, the family had a revenue of 700 koku and the family rank of Seiga, next to the Sekkan, the regent house.

sen.j: 明治維新後は侯爵家に叙せられた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the head of the family was given the title of Marquee.
After the Meiji Restoration, the head of the family was given the title of Marquee.
After the Meiji Restoration, the head of the family was given the title of Marquee.

sen.j: 家紋は五つ竜胆車。
sen.e: Its family crest is Itsuturindoguruma.
Its family crest is Itsuturindoguruma.
Its Kamon (family crest) is Itsutsu Rindoguruma crest (five gentians annulet).
sen.cmt: 「五つ竜胆車」の表記を修正family crest→Kamon (family crest)に変更

sen.j: 庶流に、中院家、北畠家、六条家六条家（村上源氏）、久世家、東久世家、岩倉家、千種家、植松家、梅溪家がある。
sen.e: Its branched families included the Nakanoin, Kitabatake, Rokujo (Murakami Genji), Koga, Higashikuze, Iwakura, Chigusa, Uematstu and Umetani.
Its branch families included the Nakanoin, Kitabatake, Rokujo (Murakami Genji), Koga, Higashikuze, Iwakura, Chigusa, Uematstu and Umetani.
Its branch families included the Nakanoin, Kitabatake, Rokujo (Murakami-Genji), Koga, Higashikuze, Iwakura, Chigusa, Uematstu and Umetani.
sen.cmt: 表記を合わせ、Murakami-Genjiとしました。

sen.j: 久我家第三十三代当主、侯爵久我通顕の長女は女優の久我美子である。
sen.e: The elder daughter of Michiaki KOGA, the thirty-third head of the Koga family and a baron, is Yoshiko KOGA, an actress.
The elder daughter of Michiaki KOGA, the thirty-third head of the Koga family and a baron, is Yoshiko KOGA, an actress.
The elder daughter of Michiaki KOGA, the thirty-third head of the Koga family and a baron, is Yoshiko KOGA, an actress.

sen.j: 曹洞宗の開祖である道元は久我家の出身とする説もある。
sen.e: Some people say that Dogen, the founder of the Soto sect, was descending from the Koga family.
Some people say that Dogen, the founder of the Soto sect, was descending from the Koga family.
Some people say that Dogen, the founder of the Soto sect, was descending from the Koga family.

sen.j: 菩提寺は京都北区紫野大徳寺内清泉寺。
sen.e: Its bodaiji is the Seisen-ji temple located in the Daitoku-ji temple, Murasakino, Kita-ku, Kyoto-city.
Its bodaiji is the Seisen-ji temple located in the Daitoku-ji temple, Murasakino, Kita-ku, Kyoto-city.
Its family temple is Seisen-ji Temple in the Daitoku-ji Temple, located at Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: bodaiji→family templeに修正、Seisen-ji Temple in the Daitoku-ji Temple、およびlocated at Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto Cityとしました。
